definition: to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Don't chant things like "loser" or taunt them when they lose.
sentences.chinese: 不要反复喊着“失败者”或者奚落他们。

sentences.english: Those who belonged to the higher classes were subjected to taunts and ridicule.
sentences.chinese: 属于上层社会的一些穆斯林会被嘲弄，被奚落。

sentences.english: Lin Lei saw the opportunity to ridicule Bai righteousness, want him to hold.
sentences.chinese: 林磊看准机会乘机奚落柏义，要他来执筹码。

sentences.english: At times he even taunts them.
The only serious stress is laid upon the degradation of tahiti .
sentences.chinese: 唯一严肃的地方是把塔希提岛奚落了一番。

sentences.english: When someone ridicules you it teaches you that nobody is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 当有人奚落你的时候，他教你懂得没有人是完美的。

sentences.english: Warrington was curious, and not ill pleased at the musician's taunts and irascibility.
sentences.chinese: 沃林顿有些惊讶，但没有计较乐师的奚落和愤怒。

sentences.english: When the class ended, he wondered why he didn't hear the cruel taunts of his fellow students.
sentences.chinese: 下课后，他纳闷儿同学们为什么没刻薄地奚落他。

sentences.english: Hostile journalists at home and abroad enjoyed ridiculing him.
sentences.chinese: 国内外抱有敌意的记者都以嘲弄奚落他为乐事。

sentences.english: In the universe of which Don Juan has a glimpse, ridicule too is included. He would consider it normal to be chastised.
sentences.chinese: 唐璜隐约窥探到的宇宙中也包括奚落和讥笑。

sentences.english: If someone puts you down,you should teach him a lesson.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人奚落你，你就应该教训教训他。

sentences.english: When the class ended, he wondered why he didn"t hear the cruel taunts of his fellow students."
sentences.chinese: 下课后，他纳闷儿同学们为什么没刻薄地奚落他。

sentences.english: About chun the imperial concubine imperial concubine eat eat grapefruit, is actually borrow ridicule her.
sentences.chinese: 炎贵妃约淳贵妃赏花吃柚，其实是借意奚落她。

sentences.english: Emerging economies reeled and decoupling was ridiculed.
sentences.chinese: 新兴经济体步履蹒跚，“脱钩论”遭到了奚落。

sentences.english: But I fended off the taunts and jibes of the family good humouredly.
sentences.chinese: 但我心平气和地顶住了家人的嘲笑和奚落。

sentences.english: You don't think they'll judge and ridicule me?
sentences.chinese: 你不认为他们会品论和奚落我？

definition: to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
